title: The Bad Romance Edition
description:
On this episode of Slate Money, hosts Felix Salmon of Fusion, Cathy O’Neil, data scientist and author of Weapons of Math Destruction, and Recode’s Edmund Lee breakdown the breakups and mergers in business and finance news this week.
Topics discussed on today’s show include:AT&T’s plan to buy entertainment and news giant Time WarnerWallonia formally approves EU-Canada, CETA trade dealBuzzy Tech Companies and how they fare in the public stock markets.Check out other Panoply podcasts at itunes.com/panoply.
Email: slatemoney@slate.com
Twitter: @felixsalmon, @mathbabedotorg, @edmundlee
Production by Veralyn Williams.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

itunes:subtitle: Slate Money talks AT&T’s planned merger with Time Warner, the CETA trade deal, and how tech companies fare in the public stock markets.
